intro: Orbea namaquensis, commonly known as the Namibian orbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a tubular corona, and bloom during the summer months. Orbea namaquensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
